title: Augusta County: John Scott to Rev Samuel Hunt, December 1, 1865
summary: In this report to Samuel Hunt, Scott discusses a variety of local issues, including the pay rate for black mechanics in Staunton and the status of Sunday schools in the city. He describes the opposition of local whites to the educational mission of the AMA in the Valley as severe. A complete monthly report is attached to the letter.
keywords: African Americans, Economy, Education, American Civil War
